intro: Heloniopsis japonica, commonly known as Japanese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lanceolate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
